feed.title: NewsTracker: bali nine
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Bali nine: Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran's latest appeal adjourned until next week
entry.summary: Jakarta: Bali nine organisers Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran have had their latest appeal against the death penalty adjourned until next week so their lawyers can present evidence to support their argument.

entry.title: Bali Nine pair's case returns to court
Bali nine executions: Former Indonesian prisoner prays for Chan and Sukumaran ahead of appeal
entry.summary: He says Sukumaran and fellow Bali nine organiser Andrew Chan, who helped guide him at church every Sunday, are good people.

entry.title: Katter questions fight for Bali Nine duo
entry.summary: Some Liberal MPs reportedly are also concerned about the government's focus on the Bali Nine ringleaders.

entry.title: Bali Nine pair await Jakarta's next move
entry.summary: With Jakarta indicating it would prefer to wait all the legal appeals to be heard before killing 10 drug convicts, it means the Bali Nine pair could avoid the firing squad for months.

entry.title: Bali nine: executions could be delayed months as judges re-examine Filipina maid's case
Bali nine executions: Phone-tapping rumours surround delay
Bali nine executions: Phone-tapping rumours surround delay
entry.summary: Indonesian parliamentarians are publicly questioning the fact that 10 prisoners on death row, including Bali nine organisers Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran, have not yet been killed.

entry.title: Bali Nine: Abbott 'still waiting for Widodo phone call'
Cabinet members urge Indonesia's President Joko Widodo to show mercy to Bali nine duo
entry.summary: Prominent figures in the Indonesian government, including senior cabinet members, have been urging President Joko Widodo to reconsider the executions of the Bali nine duo, Fairfax Media has learned.

entry.title: Bali nine: Australia's most senior Muslim cleric pleads for lives of Andrew Chan, Myuran Sukumaran
Bali nine: Andrew Chan and fiancee reunite on execution island
entry.summary: Cilacap: Andrew Chan and his Indonesian fiancee Febyanti Herewila have been reunited on Nusakambangan as the families of the Bali nine duo stepped up their campaign to convince ordinary Indonesians that the men deserve mercy.

entry.title: Bali nine: Andrew Chan and fiancee reunite on execution island
entry.summary:
The bid to see Chan was futile, and the Bali nine pair left the prison in an armoured personnel carrier 30 minutes later.

Indonesians strongly support the death penalty, but the remarkable rehabilitation of the Bali nine duo is not widely known.

entry.title: Andrew Chan's fiancee Febyanti Herewila joins visit to Bali nine execution island
entry.summary: Febyanti Herewila, fiancee of Bali nine member Andrew Chan, walks towards the boat at Wijaya Pura wharf that will take her to Nusakambangan prison island.

entry.title: Sir Richard Branson pleads for lives of Bali nine duo Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran and other drug convicts on death row
Bali nine executions: Indonesian minister threatens to release 'human tsunami' of asylum seekers
entry.summary:
MP Prananda Surya Paloh, who is a member of the same party in the ruling coalition as Mr Tedjo, said the government should have seen the positive side of the Bali nine pair in jail, according to news website Okezone.com.

Meanwhile, Indonesian demonstrators took five bags of coins to the Australian embassy to 'repay' Australian aid after the 2004 tsunami and warned they would bring their government down if the Bali nine executions were cancelled.

entry.title: Bali nine executions: Indonesian minister threatens to release 'human tsunami' of asylum seekers
entry.summary:
Indonesia could release 10,000 asylum seekers to Australia if Canberra continues to antagonise the republic over the execution of the Bali nine duo, an Indonesian minister has warned.

"With regard to the execution of Bali nine duo Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan, I, Prananda Surya Paloh, would like to say that today is a very sad day with regard to humanity," he wrote on his website.

entry.title: Bali nine duo Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran adjust to harsh new life inside 'Iron' prison
entry.summary:
Even inside the walls of Nusakambangan's "Iron" prison, Bali nine duo Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran have been able to find opportunities for humour as they await their executions.

Jamiu Owolabi Abashin, aka Raheem Agbaje Salami, has struck up a friendship with the Bali nine duo.

entry.title: Bali nine executions: Indonesia can't be sure it will be this month as other drug felons appeal
Families blocked from seeing Bali nine pair on execution island
entry.summary:
The pause should give the Bali nine duo's lawyers time to pursue a legal appeal lodged on Monday with the state administrative court in Jakarta.

The action is the second attempt to challenge the rejection of Bali nine drug smugglers clemency pleas by Mr Joko.

entry.title: Families blocked from seeing Bali nine pair on execution island
entry.summary: Bali nine pair Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran have spent three lonely days at Nusakambangan, with their families so far blocked from visiting them on the penal island where Indonesia's government plans to execute them.

entry.title: Andrew Chan and?Myuran Sukumaran families say goodbye Bali Nine smugglers
entry.summary: Chan and Sukumaran were convicted in 2005 as the ringleaders of the so-called Bali Nine, who were arrested at the holiday island's main airport for trying to smuggle 8kg (18lb) of heroin to Australia.

entry.title: Execution as spectacle: why the Bali nine duo were treated like the world's most dangerous men
Bali nine executions: Prisoner swap 'unthinkable' says Indonesian Attorney-General H.M. Prasetyo
entry.summary: The media circus surrounding the executions of the Bali nine ringleaders and eight other drug felons intensified as the "happy snap" was plastered over local media.

entry.title: Bali nine executions: Why Indonesians and Australians have different views on the death penalty for drug dealers
entry.summary: This is a cultural difference that goes some way to explaining why the executions of Bali nine ringleaders Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan have been treated so differently in the Indonesian and Australian media.

entry.title: Police chief's 'happy snap' with Bali nine pair Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran
entry.summary: They will be permitted to visit the Bali nine pair on Nusakambangan, where the men are being held in isolation cells.

entry.title: Bali nine duo Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran's families arrive ahead of executions
entry.summary: Australian Consulate staff assist Helen Chan, the mother of Bali Nine member Andrew Chan, followed by his brother Michael Chan as they arrived at Yogyarkarta airport on Thursday.

entry.title: Bali nine duo Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran's families arrive ahead of executions
entry.summary: The families of Bali nine death row duo Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran have flown into Yogyakarta as they prepare for their final visits with the condemned men.

entry.title: Bishop offers Bali Nine prisoner swap
Bali nine: Indonesian president Joko Widodo says executions will not be this week
entry.summary: Mr Joko has previously indicated he was unaware the Bali nine were arrested trying to smuggle 8.3 kilograms of heroin to Australia rather than bringing drugs into Indonesia.

entry.title: Bali nine: Indonesian president Joko Widodo says executions will not be this week
entry.summary: Mr Prasetyo said authorities were considering the last wishes of the Bali nine pair, including which religious figures would witness their deaths.

entry.title: Bali nine's Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan could be executed this weekend after transfer
entry.summary: Cilacap: Bali nine ringleaders Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan are waiting to die on Nusakambangan island, with the Indonesian Attorney-General expected to announce they will be killed as early as this weekend.

entry.title: Bali nine duo 'stoic' during heart-wrenching last moments in Kerobokan
entry.summary:
Indonesian police and security guard the fence of Ngurah Rai international airport during the transfer of Bali Nine duo Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan.

The remainder of the belongings they have accumulated in "The Tower" have been given to other inmates, including three Bali nine members who remain in the penitentiary: Si Yi Chen, Matthew Norman and Michael Czugaj.

entry.title: Bali Nine pair silent as taken away
Bali nine prisoners transferred from Kerobokan to execution island under heavy military guard
entry.summary: A Wolf armoured vehicle carrying Bali nine duo Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran leaves Kerobokan prison to begin the transfer to Nusakambangan prison island where they are to be executed.

entry.title: Bali nine prisoners transferred from Kerobokan to execution island under heavy military guard
entry.summary:
Indonesian police block the street near the entrance of Kerobokan prison where Bali nine duo Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan will be transferred to Nusakambangan prison island for their executions.

Indonesian police stand in front of a water cannon that has been positioned outside Kerobokan prison ahead of the transfer of Bali nine duo Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan.

entry.title: Bali Nine pair moved out of Kerobokan
entry.summary: Prison governor Sudjonggo said the Bali Nine pair were aware it was time to go when guards entered the supermax cells.

entry.title: Bali nine duo Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran to be transferred to Nusakambangan on Wednesday
entry.summary: He said the duo had given some of their belongings to other members of the Bali nine syndicate and Sukumaran had told them to "be careful", or behave well, after he left.

entry.title: Bali nine executions: spiritual advisers ready for final hours
Bali nine: chief prosecutor 'hopeful' Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran will be transferred within 48 hours
entry.summary: Bali's chief prosecutor says Bali nine duo Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran will be transferred to "execution island" on Wednesday or Thursday, revising an estimate he had provided earlier in the day.

entry.title: Bali nine: chief prosecutor 'hopeful' Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran will be transferred within 48 hours
entry.summary: Mr Prasetyo revealed that prisons on Nusakambangan have requested that the Bali nine duo not spend too much time in isolation on the island.

entry.title: Bali Nine execution move edges nearer
entry.summary: The men had left their belongings - such as clothes, food, bedding and kitchen utensils - with their inmate friends, including other members of the Bali Nine.

entry.title: Bali Nine execution move edges nearer
entry.summary: Prison governor Sudjonggo told reporters the Bali Nine pair were aware the day had come to leave Kerobokan jail, their home since the failed 2005 heroin smuggling plot.

entry.title: Indonesia says legal appeals irrelevant as Bali nine transfer date to be decided Tuesday
Indonesia says legal appeals irrelevant as Bali nine transfer date to be decided Tuesday
entry.summary:
Mr Prasetyo said that preparations were "95 per cent" complete for the simultaneous killing by firing squad of the Bali nine duo and eight other drug felons.

Earlier, the Bali chief prosecutor Momock Bambang Samiarso said a transfer this week to the execution island of Nusakambangan was "definite".

entry.title: Bali nine executions: Andrew Robb shelves trade delegation to Indonesia
#Coin for Abbott: Indonesians' angry backlash at PM's Bali Nine diplomacy
Undertaker says no word on Bali Nine pair
entry.summary: Besides the Bali Nine duo, seven other drug offenders on death row are in line for execution.

entry.title: Undertaker says no word on Bali Nine pair
Joko Widodo says execution of Bali Nine pair Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran will not be delayed
entry.summary: Ms Bishop appealed directly to Mr Kalla for an indefinite stay of execution for the Bali nine ringleaders, unveiling a fresh diplomatic push for the two countries to work together on tackling drug syndicates.

entry.title: Staring down the barrel: Politics and pride muffle pleas for mercy for Bali Nine duo
Bali nine executions: Julie Bishop phones Indonesia to ease tensions
Bali nine executions: Julie Bishop phones Indonesia to ease tensions
entry.summary: Bali nine executions: Firm-minded President Joko Widodo will push...

entry.title: Execution of Bali Nine duo in limbo
entry.summary: At the same time, the lawyers' complaints against the original six judges in the Bali Nine pair's trial are being examined.

entry.title: Bali nine executions: Indonesia's president did not have all the documents when he refused clemency
entry.summary: The Bali nine duo have been on death row for almost 10 years over their role in the foiled attempt to smuggle 8.3 kilograms of heroin to Australia.

entry.title: Bali nine executions: Indonesia's president did not have all the documents when he refused clemency
entry.summary: Indonesia's President Joko Widodo refused clemency for the Bali nine duo facing execution without all the documentation of their cases due to the chaotic handover to his office from his predecessor.

entry.title: Hundreds gather in Melbourne for mercy for Bali nine death row prisoners
Bali nine: Indonesia puts friendship in the firing line
entry.summary: Only a few weeks ago, Abbott said "the government will not make further public comments" about the case of the Bali nine pair, but the closed-door diplomatic niceties have clearly failed to sway the Indonesians.

entry.title: Bali nine: Indonesia puts friendship in the firing line
entry.summary: Bali nine: Tony Abbott urges Indonesia to 'reciprocate' for...

entry.title: Bali nine executions: Indonesian government warns it will not respond to threats
Bali Nine: Remember our tsunami aid, says Abbott
As Bali nine duo wait on death row, US states look to bring back firing squad executions
entry.summary: Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan, two Australian members of the Bali nine, may soon face a firing squad in Indonesia, although their transfer from Bali has been delayed giving some small amount of hope to their supporters and families.

entry.title: Bali nine case a 'law enforcement' issue says, Indonesia's Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi
entry.summary: Lawyers for the Bali nine pair had been hoping for a break, as they ready to appear in court next Tuesday.

entry.title: Bali nine case a 'law enforcement' issue says, Indonesia's Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi
entry.summary: Bali: Indonesia's Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi has acknowledged the international attention on the fate of Bali nine prisoners Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran but said that ultimately the case is "law enforcement" issue.

entry.title: Bali Nine duo receive new hope as transfer to Indonesia's 'Alcatraz' postponed
entry.summary:
Two Australian men on death row in Indonesia have been given a sliver of hope of a stay of execution after their transfer from Bali was postponed and reports two other foreigners due to face the firing squad have received a temporary reprieve.

The Australians were members of the Bali nine drug smuggling ring that was intercepted at Denpasar airport in April 2005 after a tip-off from the Australian Federal Police.

entry.title: Bali Nine: Indonesian Attorney-General delays transfer of pair but insists no delay in execution
entry.summary: The families of the Bali Nine drug smugglers facing execution have been given extra time to spend with the men, but the country's attorney general insists that they are not planning to delay their appointment with a firing squad.

entry.title: Bali nine lawyers beg Attorney-General to delay transfer to Nusakambangan island
Bali Nine's Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran to be moved to Nusakambangan island this week, authorities say
entry.summary:
Two Australian Bali Nine members on death row in Indonesia will be transferred this week to the most notorious prison on Nusakambangan island, known as Indonesia's Alcatraz.

September, 2006: Prime Minister John Howard refuses to intervene on behalf of the "Bali Nine".

entry.title: Bali Nine's Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran to be moved to Nusakambangan island this week, authorities say
entry.summary:
The head of the Bali prosecutors' office confirmed on Monday afternoon that Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran will be taken to the maximum security Batu prison on the penal island.

December: Prime minister Kevin Rudd tells Mr Yudhoyono that if any of the Bali Nine still faced the death penalty when all legal avenues had been pursued, he would plead for clemency.

entry.title: 'Options open' in Bali Nine case
Judges who handed death sentences to Bali Nine ringleaders asked for bribes
entry.summary: But as the Bali Nine pair on death row come to terms with their imminent execution, the Indonesian justice system is being accused of hypocrisy after a local ice manufacturer avoided the death penalty.

entry.title: Meeting to outline Bali Nine duo execution
entry.summary: Momock Bambang Samiarso, head of Bali's Provincial Prosecutors Office on Monday finalised his plans to move the Bali Nine pair from Kerobokan jail "this week, as soon as possible".

entry.title: Bali nine death sentence judges 'asked for bribes' for a lighter sentence: new claim
Bali nine death sentence judges 'asked for bribes' for a lighter sentence: new claim
entry.summary: The new claim follows the shock intervention of the Bali nine's former legal counsel, Muhammad Rifan, last weekend, who said there had been an "intervention" that could discredit him but provided no details.
